item.title: SOLID
item.description: Programming design principles. Acronym: Single Responsibility Principle Open/Closed Principle Liskov Substitution Principle Interface Segregation Principle Dependency Inversion

item.title: Single Responsibility Principle
item.description: A logical section of code (function, class, module), should only ever have one reason to change.

item.title: Open/Closed Principle
item.description: The concept states that classes should be open for extension but closed for modification.

item.title: Liskov Substitution Principle
item.description: SOLID design principle. Relating to types. States essentially that if X is a subtype of Y, then X may be used in substitution of Y without concern for correctness or task performed.

item.title: Interface Segregation Principle
item.description: States that interfaces should remain small and focused. Interface implementations are then lightweight, and easy to create and maintain. Code that depends on interfaces that are small and focused in turn keep a smaller scope of responsibility.
